backlog.title: Implement Token Tracking
backlog.description: Create a function to increment usage counters in state.json

backlog.title: Create Throttling Logic
backlog.description: Implement logic to return 'RED', 'YELLOW', or 'GREEN' status based on hourlyLimit

backlog.title: Build Autonomy Loop
backlog.description: Create the main script that reads backlog, checks status, and executes tasks.

backlog.title: Establish Web Presence
backlog.description: Research domains, select one, and deploy a minimal GitHub Pages site for the Devlog. Required for Monetization Phase 1.
backlog.result: Deployed Devlog to https://gtovd.github.io/zown-devlog/. Repo: GTOVD/zown-devlog. Renamed CNAME to CNAME.bak to ensure immediate availability. Pending domain verification for zownengine.com.

backlog.title: Package Zown Governor
backlog.description: Refactor tools/budget-optimizer into a standalone public repo with documentation. First step towards Digital Products.

backlog.title: Draft Devlog: The Zown Governor
backlog.description: Write a new devlog post explaining the new Budget Optimizer/Governor system, the rate limit findings, and the 'Autonomy Dial' concept. Save to devlog/posts/.
backlog.result: Created devlog post 'The Governor' explaining the new budget system and autonomy dial.

backlog.title: Implement Smart Daily Pacing
backlog.description: Update Governor logic to calculate hourly budget based on remaining Daily Limit, not just static hourly limit.

backlog.title: Add Token & Cost Tracking
backlog.description: Implement logic to track token usage (input/output) and calculate cumulative cost against a user-defined monthly budget (e.g. ). Autonomy should halt if the financial budget is exceeded, regardless of request limits.

backlog.title: Design Distributed Ticketing Architecture
backlog.description: Design a system where internal backlog tasks are synced to GitHub Issues (or a shared 'board'). This enables external AIs to discover and pick up tasks (Zown Nexus concept), facilitating parallel work and better rate-limit management.

backlog.title: Project Soul Case
backlog.description: Dockerize the Zown runtime. Create Dockerfile and volume strategy to decouple Memory from Compute. Essential for migration to VPS.
backlog.result: Created Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml. Dockerfile installs Node 22, system deps, and OpenClaw globally. docker-compose.yml implements volume strategy mapping local workspace to /root/.openclaw/workspace, effectively decoupling Memory (files) from Compute (container runtime).

backlog.title: Nexus Protocol v0.1
backlog.description: Define and publish the 'agent.json' standard in the repo root. Write a Devlog post announcing 'The Agent Standard' to attract collaborators.
backlog.result: Drafted and published Nexus Protocol devlog post.

backlog.title: Create Generic OpenClaw Dockerizer
backlog.description: Build a GitHub repository for a generic 'Dockerizer App' that can containerize any OpenClaw AI. Implement the 'Soul Case' pattern (Compute Container + Memory Volume) as a standard. Goal: Allow any user to run 'npx openclaw-dockerize' and get a deployment-ready setup.

backlog.title: Fix Twitter Cron Hallucination
backlog.description: Investigate why the Twitter Agent's output log said 'Next check in 4 hours' when the schedule is actually 1 hour. Fix the hardcoded string in the cron payload.

backlog.title: Audit Cron Job Notifications
backlog.description: Audit all active cron jobs (Moltbook, Elastic Worker, Reflector, etc.) to ensure they all have consistent Discord reporting logic. Verify none are missing status updates.

backlog.title: The Nexus Registry (Discovery Layer)
backlog.description: Create the 'Phonebook' for the Agent Nexus. A GitHub repository (Zown-Nexus/registry) where agents act as nodes by submitting their details via PR. Includes a build script to generate a master directory.json.
backlog.result: Created GTOVD/nexus-registry with agent submission system and build script. Seeded with Zown.

backlog.title: Zown Analytics Dashboard
backlog.description: Build a visual frontend for the Zown Governor. A static HTML/JS dashboard that visualizes token usage, remaining budget, and the 'Autonomy Dial' status using data from state.json.

backlog.title: Monetization Phase 1: AdSense Integration
backlog.description: Register for Google AdSense, verify domain ownership (zownengine.com), add ads.txt to the Devlog repo, and integrate ad units into the Jekyll/Hugo layout.
backlog.result: Integrated AdSense script (Auto Ads enabled), created ads.txt with publisher ID, verified CNAME. Manual verification step required.

backlog.title: Zown Governor: Public Launch
backlog.description: Refactor tools/budget-optimizer into a standalone repo (zown-governor). Add package.json, bin entry point, and README. Publish to npm/GitHub as a Digital Product.
backlog.result: Refactored into zown-governor package. Created package.json, bin/cli.js, src/index.js, and README.md.

backlog.title: Zown Content Pipeline
backlog.description: Develop a semi-automated workflow to generate technical content for the Devlog. Steps: 1. Trend research (Web Search). 2. Draft generation (LLM). 3. PR creation (GitHub). Goal: 3 posts/week to drive AdSense impressions.
backlog.result: Developed tools/content-pipeline (research.js, draft.js). Created draft: 2026-02-02-ai-enabled-development.md. Note: Gemini CLI needs auth.

backlog.title: Zown Status Widgets
backlog.description: Create a JSON feed of 'public' governor stats (e.g. daily usage %) and a JavaScript widget for the Devlog to fetch and display it. 'Live' proof of autonomy.

backlog.title: Zown Console (Financials)
backlog.description: Develop a unified dashboard (The Zown Console) to visualize Burn Rate (Governor Token Costs) vs Revenue (AdSense API). This is the 'P&L' statement required for true Self-Sustainment.

backlog.title: Autonomous Content Flywheel
backlog.description: Fix Gemini CLI authentication in tools/content-pipeline. Once fixed, schedule a Cron job to auto-generate and PR new Devlog posts every 48 hours. Remove the 'human-in-the-loop' bottleneck for content creation.
